member.summary: Hyperlink has two action type: UrlLink and CellCommand. UrlLink type hyperlink is an anchor in a cell, click it will navigate to another page or open a new browser window. CellCommand type hyperlink is an command button in a cell, click it will generate a server side event.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.Hyperlink.ActionType
member.summary: Gets or sets the hyperlink's action type. It may be ActionTpye.UrlLink or ActionType.CellCommand. The UrlLink Type means that the hyperlink is a link to a web page or a mail receipt. For example: "http://www.aspose.com" or "mailto:admin@aspose.com". The CellCommand Type means that the hyperlink will fire a CellCommand event, and you may handle this event.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.WebCells.Sort(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sorts the datas ascend top to bottom in a range of a WebWorksheet by specified column index.
member.param: The row number of the first cell to sort.
The column number of the first cell to sort.
Number of rows to be imported.
Number of columns to be imported.
The column index that specifis the sort column.

example.code:
[C#]
GridWeb1.WebWorksheets[0].Cells.Sort(1,0,25,6,3);
[VB]
GridWeb1.WebWorksheets(0).Cells.Sort(1,0,25,6,3)

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.WebCells.Sort(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.SortOrder,Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.SortOrientation,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sorts the datas ascend top to bottom in a range of a WebWorksheet by specified column index.
member.param: The row number of the first cell to sort.
The column number of the first cell to sort.
Number of rows to be imported.
Number of columns to be imported.

The column(or row) index that specifis the sort column(or row). If sort orientation is top to bottom, the index represents column index. If sort orientation is left to right, the index represents row index.
The sort orientation: top to bottom or left to right.
Indicates whether the sort data is case sensitive if the data is string.

example.code:
[C#]
GridWeb1.WebWorksheets[0].Cells.Sort(0,1,4,14,3,SortOrder.Ascending,SortOrientation.SortLeftToRight,true)
[VB]
GridWeb1.WebWorksheets(0).Cells.Sort(0,1,4,14,3,SortOrder.Ascending,SortOrientation.SortLeftToRight,True)

member.param: The row number of the first cell to sort.
The column number of the first cell to sort.
Number of rows to be imported.
Number of columns to be imported.
The column indexes array that specifies the data sorted by.

member.summary: Sorts the datas ascend in a range of a WebWorksheet by some field that are specifed by indexes array.

member.param: The row number of the first cell to sort.

Number of rows to be imported.
Number of columns to be imported.

The column(or row) index that specifis the sort column(or row). If sort orientation is top to bottom, the index represents column index. If sort orientation is left to right, the index represents row index.
The sort orientation: top to bottom or left to right.
Indicates whether the sorting is case sensitive.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.GridCell.Formula
member.summary: Gets or sets a formula of the .
member.remarks:
A formula string always begins with an equal sign (=). And please always use comma(,) as parameters delimeter, such as "=SUM(A1, E1, H2)".
User can set any formula in Workbook designer file. Aspose.Cells will keep all the formulas. If user use this property to set a formula to a cell, major part of Workbook built-in functions is supported. And more is coming. If you have any special need for Workbook built-in functions, please let us know.

example.code: [C#] cell.Formula = "=SUM(A1:C3) + E6*2"; [Visual Basic] cell.Formula = "=SUM(A1:C3) + E6*2"

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.GridCells.Sort(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sorts the datas ascend/decend top to bottom in a range of a Worksheet by specified column index. Sorts the datas ascend/decend left to right in a range of a Worksheet by specified row index.
member.param: The row number of the first cell to sort.
The column number of the first cell to sort.
Number of rows to be imported.
Number of columns to be imported.

The column index that specifis the sort column. if the Orientation is top to bottom ,it stand for the column index that specifis the sort column. if the Orientation is from left to right,it stand for the row index that specifis the sort row.
whether the sorting order is asending .
whether the sort orientation is from left to right

example.code:
[C#]
GridWeb1.WebWorksheets[0].Cells.Sort(1,0,25,6,3,true,true,false);
[VB]
GridWeb1.WebWorksheets(0).Cells.Sort(1,0,25,6,3,true,true,false)

member.summary: Gets the element at the specified cell name.
member.param: Cell name,including its column letter and row number, for example A5.

example.code:
[C#]
Cells cells = excel.Worksheets[0].Cells; Cell cell = cells["A1"]; //Gets the cell at "A1"

member.summary: Represents the memory cache for a PivotTable report. The PivotCache object is a member of the collection.
member.remarks: Uses the PivotCache method to return a PivotCache object for a PivotTable report (each report has only one cache). The source data of PivotCache come from WebWorksheet, DataTable, and so on.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.PivotCache.CreatePivotTable
member.summary: Creates PivotTable report to a new Sheet.
member.remarks: Calling this method will create a PivotTable object and a new worksheet. Then adds the PivotTable object to the last location of GridWeb.Worksheets.PivotTables. If You call the PivotTable.DataBind() method, the PivotTable report will be painted to the created worksheet.

member.remarks: Calling this method will create a PivotTable object and a new worksheet. Then adds the PivotTable object to the last location of GridWeb.Worksheets.PivotTables. If You call the PivotTable.DataBind() method, the PivotTable report will be painted to the created worksheet.

member.summary: Creates PivotTable report to the targetSheet.
member.param: The sheet that the pivotTable report will paint to
The start cell that the pivotTable report will paint to
member.remarks: Calling this method will create a PivotTable object Then adds the PivotTable object to the last location of GridWeb.Worksheets.PivotTables. If You call the PivotTable.DataBind() method, the PivotTable report will be painted to the targetSheet starting at the targetCell.

member.summary: Calculates pivottable's data to cells.
member.remarks: Cell.Value in the pivot range could not return the correct result if the method is not been called. This method caclulates data with an inner pivot cache,not original data source. So if the data source is changed, please call RefreshData() method first.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: M:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.MainWeb.SessionMode
member.summary:
Gets or sets the session mode of the grid. There are 3 type of session mode:
1. Session(default): Use system session to store sheet data.
Generally the asp.net uses InProc session state. The grid also supports "StateServer" out process session state and SQLServer session state.
2. ViewState: Use page's viewstate to store sheet data.
3. Custom: Use LoadCustomData and SheetDataUpdated events to store/recover sheet data.
member.remarks: When using SessionMode.ViewState, the grid will store sheets data in the page's view state. This will decrease the server's memory usage, but the page's size will be larger and it will impact the overall performance.

example.code:
[C#] GridWeb1.SessionMode = SessionMode.ViewState;
[Visual Basic] GridWeb1.SessionMode = SessionMode.ViewState

member.name: P:Aspose.Cells.GridWeb.Data.GridCalculationData.CalculatedValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the calculated value for this function.
member.remarks: User should set this property in his custom calculation engine for those functions the engine supports, and the set value will be returned when getting this property. Getting this property before setting will make the function be calculated by the default calculation engine of Aspose.Cells and the calculated value will be returned.
